00048 #ifndef GFAL_LONG64_FORMAT
00049 #if defined(__ia64__) || defined(__x86_64)
00050 #define GFAL_LONG64_FORMAT "%ld"
00051 #elif defined(_WIN32)
00052 #define GFAL_LONG64_FORMAT "%I64d"
00053 #else
00054 #define GFAL_LONG64_FORMAT "%lld"
00055 #endif
00056 #endif
00057 #ifndef GFAL_LONG64
00058 #if defined(__ia64__) || defined(__x86_64)
00059 #define GFAL_LONG64 long
00060 #elif defined(_WIN32)
00061 #define GFAL_LONG64 __i64
00062 #else
00063 #define GFAL_LONG64 long long
00064 #endif
00065 #endif

00070         fprintf (stderr, format, ## __VA_ARGS__)
00071 #else
00072 #define GFAL_DEBUG(format, ...)

00095         char *turl;
00096         int status;
00097         char *explanation;

00099 #if ! defined(linux) || defined(_LARGEFILE64_SOURCE)
00100         struct stat64 stat;
00101 #endif
00102         struct gfal_filestatus_ *subpaths;
00103         int nbsubpaths;
00104         TFileLocality locality;
00105         char *checksumtype;
00106         char *checksum;
00107     char **spacetokens;
00108     int nbspacetokens;
00109 } gfal_filestatus;

00118 typedef struct gfal_request_ {
00119         /* [optional]
00120          * if set to 1, 'surls' to NULL, and endpoint specified,
00121          * 'nbfiles' SURLs will be generated */
00122         int                                                     generatesurls;
00123 
00124         /* [optional]
00125          * only used to generate SURLs, if specified */
00126         char *                                          relative_path;
00127 
00128         /* [required]
00129          * number of files in 'surls' */
00130         int                                                     nbfiles;
00131 
00132         /* [required]
00133          * list of surls */
00134         char **                                         surls;
00135 
00136         /* [optional]
00137          * endpoint */
00138         char *                                          endpoint;
00139         
00140         /* [required by gfal_turlsfromsurls]
00141          * 0 for get request, 1 for put request */
00142         int                                                     oflag;
00143         
00144         /* [optional]
00145          * list of file sizes
00146          * can be useful for gfal_turlsfromsurls with put request */
00147         GFAL_LONG64 *                           filesizes;
00148         
00149         /* [optional]
00150          * SE type to use *by default* */
00151         enum se_type                            defaultsetype;
00152         
00153         /* [optional]
00154          * SE type to use - will fail if this type cannot be used */
00155         enum se_type                            setype;
00156         
00157         /* [optional]
00158          * if set to 1, no bdii call will be done
00159          * endpoint must be set up for SRM-compliant SE */
00160         int                                                     no_bdii_check;
00161 
00162         /* [optional]
00163          * timeout */
00164         int                                                     timeout;
00165 
00166         /* [optional]
00167          * list of protocols to use */
00168         char **                                         protocols;
00169 
00170         /* [optional] only used with SRMv2 */
00171         char *                                          srmv2_spacetokendesc;
00172         int                                                     srmv2_desiredpintime;
00173         int                                                     srmv2_lslevels;
00174         int                                                     srmv2_lsoffset;
00175         int                                                     srmv2_lscount;
00176 } *gfal_request;
00177  
00182 struct _gfal_srmv2_opt{
00183         int opt_srmv2_desiredpintime;                   //      optional desired default endpoint
00184         char** opt_srmv2_protocols;                             // optional protocols list for manual set
00185         char * opt_srmv2_spacetokendesc;                // optional spacetokens desc for srmv2   
00186          
00187 };

00193 struct _gfal_request_state{
00194         char *                                          srmv2_token;
00195         struct srmv2_filestatus *       srmv2_statuses;
00196         struct srmv2_pinfilestatus *srmv2_pinstatuses;
00197         enum gfal_srm_proto current_request_proto;
00198         char *                                          request_endpoint; 
00199         gboolean                                        finished;                       // finished or not
00200         int                                                     number;                         // number of files in request
00201  };
00202  
00203 struct gfal_handle_ {
00204         // INPUTS
00205 
00206         int                                                     generatesurls;
00207         char *                                          relative_path;
00208         int                                                     nbfiles;
00209         char **                                         surls;
00210         char *                                          endpoint;
00211         int                                                     oflag;
00212         GFAL_LONG64 *                           filesizes;
00213         enum se_type                            defaultsetype;
00214         enum se_type                            setype;
00215         int                                                     no_bdii_check;
00216         int                                                     timeout;
00217         char **                                         protocols;
00218 
00219         // Only used with SRMv2
00220         char *                                          srmv2_spacetokendesc;
00221         int                                                     srmv2_desiredpintime;
00222         int                                                     srmv2_lslevels;
00223         int                                                     srmv2_lsoffset;
00224         int                                                     srmv2_lscount;
00225 
00226         // OUTPUTS
00227 
00228         // For Classic SEs
00229         struct sfn_filestatus *         sfn_statuses;
00230 
00231         // For SRMv1 SEs
00232         int                                                     srm_reqid;
00233         struct srm_filestatus *         srm_statuses;
00234         struct srm_mdfilestatus *       srm_mdstatuses;
00235 
00236         // For SRMv2.2 SEs
00237         char *                                          srmv2_token;
00238         struct srmv2_filestatus *       srmv2_statuses;
00239         struct srmv2_pinfilestatus *srmv2_pinstatuses;
00240         struct srmv2_mdfilestatus *     srmv2_mdstatuses;
00241 
00242         int free_endpoint;
00243 
00244         // Common results
00245         int returncode; // size of the new results
00246         int results_size; // size of the old results
00247         gfal_filestatus *results;
00248         GError* err;                                                    // Last error reported
00249         enum gfal_srm_proto srm_proto_type;             // define the protocole version of SRM choosen by default
00250         gboolean initiated;                                     // 1 if initiated, else error
00251         // pointer to srmv2 set option
00252         gfal_srmv2_opt* srmv2_opt;
00253         // pointer to the last request resu
00254         gfal_request_state* last_request_state;
00255         // struct of the catalog opts
00256         struct _catalog_opts catalog_opt;
00257         //struct for the file descriptors
00258         gfal_descriptors_container fdescs;
00259 };

00334 typedef struct _gfal_file {
00335         char *file;                    // url given by user
00336         char *lfn;
00337         char *guid;
00338         enum gfal_file_catalog catalog;     // file catalog type: lfc or edg
00339         int nbreplicas;
00340         int nberrors;                  // nb of non-working replicas
00341         gfal_replica *replicas;
00342         int current_replica;
00343         gfal_handle gobj;
00344         char *turl;
00345         int errcode;
00346         char *errmsg;
00347 } *gfal_file;

00349 struct dir_info {
00350         DIR     *dir;
00351         struct proto_ops *pops;
00352 };
00353 
00354 struct proto_ops {
00355         char    *proto_name;
00356         int     libok;  /* -1 (library is not accessible), 0 (library not checked yet), 1 (library ok) */
00357         int     (*checkprotolib)(struct proto_ops *);
00358         int     (*geterror)();
00359         int     (*maperror)(struct proto_ops *, int);
00360         int     (*access)(const char *, int);
00361         int     (*chmod)(const char *, mode_t);
00362         int     (*close)(int);
00363         int     (*closedir)(DIR *);
00364         off_t   (*lseek)(int, off_t, int);
00365 #if ! defined(linux) || defined(_LARGEFILE64_SOURCE)
00366         off64_t (*lseek64)(int, off64_t, int);
00367 #endif
00368         int     (*lstat)(const char *, struct stat *);
00369 #if ! defined(linux) || defined(_LARGEFILE64_SOURCE)
00370         int     (*lstat64)(const char *, struct stat64 *);
00371 #endif
00372         int     (*mkdir)(const char *, mode_t);
00373         int     (*open)(const char *, int, ...);
00374         DIR     *(*opendir)(const char *);
00375         ssize_t (*read)(int, void *, size_t);
00376         struct dirent   *(*readdir)(DIR *);
00377 #if ! defined(linux) || defined(_LARGEFILE64_SOURCE)
00378         struct dirent64 *(*readdir64)(DIR *);
00379 #endif
00380         int     (*rename)(const char *, const char *);
00381         int     (*rmdir)(const char *);
00382         ssize_t (*setfilchg)(int, const void *, size_t);
00383         int     (*stat)(const char *, struct stat *);
00384 #if ! defined(linux) || defined(_LARGEFILE64_SOURCE)
00385         int     (*stat64)(const char *, struct stat64 *);
00386 #endif
00387         int     (*unlink)(const char *);
00388         ssize_t (*write)(int, const void *, size_t);
00389 };
00390

00392         int     fd;
00393         int     size;
00394         gfal_file gfile;
00395         struct proto_ops *pops;
00396 };
